intro: Tylophora rockii, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody vines and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue and bloom in the summer months. Tylophora rockii is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional medicinal uses in Chinese herbal medicine.
